summary: The 'Protecting American Capital Act of 2025' mandates an annual report from the Secretary of the Treasury to Congress regarding U.S. portfolio investments in the People's Republic of China. This report must detail the types of U.S. investors (including State pension funds) and Chinese entities receiving investments (including those subject to US sanctions and those receiving significant funds), and includes data back to 2008. The bill aims to increase oversight of U.S. financial exposure to China.
